Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Emilia Clarke.

programme.title: The Shining
programme.desc: An aspiring writer takes a caretaking job at a remote mountain hotel. It has closed for the winter, and he has been hired to get the place ready for the next season. But evil spirits haunting its corridors destroy his sanity, causing the unhinged author to rampage through the hotel and terrorise his wife and young son. Stanley Kubrick's horror, based on the Stephen King novel, with Jack Nicholson, Shelley Duvall, Danny Lloyd and Scatman Crothers.

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: A shy, withdrawn teenager discovers she has paranormal powers, which she uses to protect herself from her abusive mother and classmates. When a friendly student invites her to the prom, she is determined to enjoy herself and is amazed when she is crowned queen of the ball - but joy turns to fury when her tormentors play a cruel prank. Brian De Palma's adaptation of Stephen King's horror novel, with Sissy Spacek, Piper Laurie and Amy Irving.(n)

programme.title: Annabelle
programme.desc: A man buys his pregnant wife a vintage doll, which places their lives in jeopardy. Members of a Satanic cult have their eyes on the antique toy, and break into their house to prepare a ritual that will transform the harmless plaything into a terrifying monster. Horror spin-off from The Conjuring, starring Annabelle Wallis and Ward Horton.(n)

programme.title: Cocoon
programme.desc: The elderly residents of a retirement home treat themselves to an occasional dip in the pool at an abandoned house. It turns out that friendly aliens in human form are using the place to restore dormant members of their species - and energy from their cocoons is giving the old-timers a new lease of life. Ron Howard's sci-fi drama, with Wilford Brimley, Jessica Tandy, Hume Cronyn, Don Ameche and Steve Guttenberg.(n)

programme.title: Masters of the Universe
programme.desc: The heroic warrior He-Man sets out to bring an end to the evil Skeletor's reign of terror, but is transported to Earth by a cosmic key, with his arch enemy's henchman in hot pursuit. Fantasy adventure, starring Dolph Lundgren, Frank Langella, Meg Foster and Billy Barty.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy sequel, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner
programme.desc: A boy arrives in an isolated community of children, with no memory of who he is or the outside world. When another new arrival brings an ominous message, he realises time is running out for the group and they must find an escape route through a deadly labyrinth if they are to survive. Sci-fi adventure based on James Dashner's novel, starring Dylan O'Brien, Kaya Scodelario and Patricia Clarkson.(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: A gifted young scientist joins a secret project researching inter-dimensional travel, and return from a journey to another world granted superhuman powers. Their abilities make them the only hope for Earth's survival when a colleague who was lost on their expedition returns to wreak vengeance. Superhero adventure, starring Miles Teller, Michael B Jordan, Kate Mara and Jamie Bell.(n)

programme.title: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: A colony of super-intelligent apes thrives following a global virus outbreak that wipes out much of the human race. A survivor tries to make peace with the leader of the apes, but their efforts to reach an understanding are threatened by warmongers on both sides. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Andy Serkis, Jason Clarke and Gary Oldman.(n)

programme.title: Alex Zane's Cinecast
programme.desc: Alex Zane takes a look at the new films coming to Sky Cinema this month, highlighting all the biggest premieres and some of his personal favourites.(n)

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: Two children are sent by their parents to spend a week at their grandparents' remote farm. They are confused by the old couple's strange house rules, but as they investigate, they discover something disturbing is going on - and that they may not be returning home alive. Horror, starring Olivia DeJonge and Ed Oxenbould.(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner
programme.desc: A boy arrives in an isolated community of children, with no memory of who he is or the outside world. When another new arrival brings an ominous message, he realises time is running out for the group and they must find an escape route through a deadly labyrinth if they are to survive. Sci-fi adventure based on James Dashner's novel, starring Dylan O'Brien, Kaya Scodelario and Patricia Clarkson.(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: A gifted young scientist joins a secret project researching inter-dimensional travel, and return from a journey to another world granted superhuman powers. Their abilities make them the only hope for Earth's survival when a colleague who was lost on their expedition returns to wreak vengeance. Superhero adventure, starring Miles Teller, Michael B Jordan, Kate Mara and Jamie Bell.(n)

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: At the height of the Cold War, former superheroes driven into retirement by public outcry are confronted with the murder of one of their number. As they face the possibility of a conspiracy to eliminate them, they must contend with a world edging closer to the brink of nuclear war. Sci-fi drama, based on Alan Moore and Dave Gibbons' graphic novel, starring Patrick Wilson, Jackie Earle Haley, Malin Akerman and Billy Crudup.(n)

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: Two children are sent by their parents to spend a week at their grandparents' remote farm. They are confused by the old couple's strange house rules, but as they investigate, they discover something disturbing is going on - and that they may not be returning home alive. Horror, starring Olivia DeJonge and Ed Oxenbould.(n)

programme.title: Full Metal Jacket
programme.desc: Raw recruits undergo harsh training under a domineering Marine drill sergeant after being called up for service in the Vietnam War, but his brutal methods lead to the breakdown of one of his cadets. Eventually, some of the fully trained soldiers get their first taste of combat in 1968. Stanley Kubrick's drama, starring Matthew Modine, Adam Baldwin, Vincent D'Onofrio and R Lee Ermey.

programme.title: Partisan
programme.desc: A young boy raised to be an assassin starts to question the ways of his community's charismatic and domineering leader. Drama, with Vincent Cassel, Jeremy Chabriel and Florence Mezzara.

programme.title: Johnny Guitar
programme.desc: Saloon manager Vienna opens a casino in readiness for the boomtown days expected when the railroad arrives in town. A hard-nosed female rancher plans to stop her from attracting unwanted settlers onto her land, so Vienna hires a gunslinger for protection. Western, starring Joan Crawford, Mercedes McCambridge, Sterling Hayden and Ernest Borgnine.

programme.title: The Necessary Death of Charlie Countryman
programme.desc: A troubled American travels to Romania in the aftermath of his mother's death. He becomes obsessed with a cellist he meets who is concealing a violent past. His efforts to romance her could cost him his life following a run-in with her brutally violent husband. Drama, starring Shia LaBeouf, Evan Rachel Wood and Mads Mikkelsen.

programme.title: Ex Machina
programme.desc: A computer programmer working for the world's biggest search engine is given the opportunity to spend a week at the remote home of his boss, a hi-tech genius. The break turns out to be an elaborate experiment, in which he must test the world's first truly artificial intelligence, which is housed in the body of a beautiful robot girl. Sci-fi drama, starring Domhnall Gleeson, Alicia Vikander and Oscar Isaac.

programme.title: Strangers on a Train
programme.desc: A charming psychopath meets a tennis professional on a train and suggests that they each commit a murder on the other's behalf. However, when the deranged man goes through with his part of the deal, the sportsman faces a race against time to prove his innocence. Alfred Hitchcock's thriller, based on the novel by Patricia Highsmith, starring Robert Walker, Farley Granger and Ruth Roman.

programme.title: Broadcast News
programme.desc: The highly strung producer of a Washington news bureau falls for a handsome but arrogant and totally untalented new anchorman, but is unaware a humble reporter friend is deeply infatuated with her. Comedy, starring Holly Hunter, William Hurt and Albert Brooks. Featuring an uncredited cameo from Jack Nicholson.

programme.title: MASH
programme.desc: American battlefield surgeons embark on a campaign of drinking, womanising and practical jokes in an attempt to alleviate the horror of the Korean War. Satirical comedy drama directed by Robert Altman, which spawned a long-running TV series. Starring Donald Sutherland, Elliott Gould, Tom Skerritt, Sally Kellerman and Robert Duvall.

programme.title: Cake
programme.desc: A woman whose son died during a car accident that left her in constant pain becomes obsessed with the suicide of a young mother she met at a support group, and forms a touching friendship with her husband. Drama, starring Jennifer Aniston, Anna Kendrick and Sam Worthington.

programme.title: Brokeback Mountain
programme.desc: A doomed love affair between two Wyoming cowboys develops over the course of 20 years. The relationship begins when they are hired to herd sheep on a remote mountain in the 1960s, and though they go their separate ways and try to settle down to married life, they are unable to overcome their desire for each other and continue to meet in secret. Ang Lee's drama, starring Heath Ledger, Jake Gyllenhaal, Michelle Williams and Anne Hathaway.

programme.title: Ex Machina
programme.desc: A computer programmer working for the world's biggest search engine is given the opportunity to spend a week at the remote home of his boss, a hi-tech genius. The break turns out to be an elaborate experiment, in which he must test the world's first truly artificial intelligence, which is housed in the body of a beautiful robot girl. Sci-fi drama, starring Domhnall Gleeson, Alicia Vikander and Oscar Isaac.

programme.title: Wild
programme.desc: A series of devastating personal traumas leave a woman feeling self-destructive and lost. After spending years behaving recklessly, she decides to turn things around by embarking on an epic, solo trek along America's 1,000-mile-long Pacific Crest Trail, which gives her the time and space to reassess her existence. Drama based on a true story, starring Reese Witherspoon and Laura Dern.

programme.title: Election
programme.desc: A teacher develops an irrational dislike for an overambitious student and plans to sabotage her campaign for school president. He persuades a dim-witted athlete to stand, in the hope he will pip the high-achieving front-runner to the post - but the intervention of another student throws the plan into disarray. Satirical comedy, starring Matthew Broderick, Reese Witherspoon, Chris Klein and Jessica Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Klute
programme.desc: A private detective investigates the disappearance of a scientist in New York, but finds his only lead is a prostitute with a tenuous connection to the missing man - and his attempts to gain her help are soon hampered by shadowy figures intent on silencing her. Alan J Pakula's thriller, starring Donald Sutherland, Roy Scheider and an Oscar-winning Jane Fonda.(n)

programme.title: A Dirty Shame
programme.desc: A bump on the head transforms a sexually repressed housewife into a sex-addicted exhibitionist - who, finding her husband can no longer fulfil her needs, goes in search of satisfaction in Baltimore's seedy underworld. John Waters' comedy, starring Tracey Ullman, Johnny Knoxville, Selma Blair and Chris Isaak.(n)

programme.title: The Hurricane
programme.desc: Boxer Rubin `Hurricane' Carter dreams of winning the middleweight world title, only to be wrongfully thrown into prison for the murders of three people in a bar. Nineteen years later, a teenager reads the fighter's autobiography and sets out on a campaign to free him. Fact-based drama, starring Denzel Washington, John Hannah, Deborah Kara Unger, Liev Schreiber and Dan Hedaya.(n)

programme.title: Cold in July
programme.desc: A small-town man is hailed as a hero after he shoots dead a burglar who had broken into his home. He begins to fear for his life when the thief's father turns up seeking revenge, which is only the first in a series of events that plunge his simple life into chaos. Crime thriller based on Joe R Lansdale's novel, starring Michael C Hall, Sam Shepard and Don Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Whiplash
programme.desc: A talented young jazz drummer thinks all his dreams have come true when he lands a place at a prestigious music academy. However, the experience turns into a nightmare thanks to an uncompromising tutor who will stop at nothing to make his students realise their potential - including physical and mental abuse. Drama, starring Miles Teller, JK Simmons and Paul Reiser.(n)

programme.title: American Sniper
programme.desc: A Navy Seal becomes a legend to his colleagues thanks to his skills as a deadly sniper, but he finds living an ordinary life as a husband and father difficult to deal with. Biopic based on the experiences of real-life Iraq conflict veteran Chris Kyle, directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller and Kyle Gallner.(n)

programme.title: The Birds
programme.desc: A San Francisco socialite takes a shine to a man she meets by chance, and follows him home to a Californian coastal community. Her arrival coincides with a series of mysterious attacks on people by birds, which soon escalates as vast flocks go on the warpath. Alfred Hitchcock's thriller, based on a Daphne du Maurier short story, starring Tippi Hedren, Rod Taylor, Suzanne Pleshette, Jessica Tandy and Veronica Cartwright.(n)

programme.title: Cold in July
programme.desc: A small-town man is hailed as a hero after he shoots dead a burglar who had broken into his home. He begins to fear for his life when the thief's father turns up seeking revenge, which is only the first in a series of events that plunge his simple life into chaos. Crime thriller based on Joe R Lansdale's novel, starring Michael C Hall, Sam Shepard and Don Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Whiplash
programme.desc: A talented young jazz drummer thinks all his dreams have come true when he lands a place at a prestigious music academy. However, the experience turns into a nightmare thanks to an uncompromising tutor who will stop at nothing to make his students realise their potential - including physical and mental abuse. Drama, starring Miles Teller, JK Simmons and Paul Reiser.(n)

programme.title: American Sniper
programme.desc: A Navy Seal becomes a legend to his colleagues thanks to his skills as a deadly sniper, but he finds living an ordinary life as a husband and father difficult to deal with. Biopic based on the experiences of real-life Iraq conflict veteran Chris Kyle, directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller and Kyle Gallner.(n)

programme.title: The Silence of the Lambs
programme.desc: Trainee FBI agent Clarice Starling is sent to interview an imprisoned psychopath with a taste for eating his victims. The inmate offers to help catch a serial killer who is holding a politician's daughter hostage - but to learn what he knows, Clarice has to engage in his dangerous mind games. Jonathan Demme's Oscar-winning thriller, based on Thomas Harris's novel, starring Jodie Foster, Anthony Hopkins, Scott Glenn and Ted Levine.(n)

programme.title: 10 Years
programme.desc: Old friends wrestle with personal problems at their 10th high-school reunion. A man planning to propose to his girlfriend has second thoughts when he runs into the love of his teen years, a former bully tries to make amends but ends up reverting to his old ways, and a famous rock star is still too shy to talk to the girl he used to have a crush on. Comedy drama, starring Channing Tatum and Rosario Dawson.

programme.title: Flying Tigers
programme.desc: An American pilot leads a squadron of volunteer aviators to help China's fledgling air force fight the Japanese during the Second World War. However, he has to contend with the consequences when the actions of an arrogant hotshot pilot lead to the death of a fellow veteran airman. Drama, starring John Wayne, John Carroll, Anna Lee and Paul Kelly.

programme.title: The Man from Laramie
programme.desc: A cavalry officer determines to avenge the death of his brother, but rather than target the Apaches who killed him, he vows to go after the gang who supplied them with their weapons - leading to conflict with the sadistic son of an elderly rancher. Anthony Mann's Western, starring James Stewart, Arthur Kennedy, Donald Crisp and Cathy O'Donnell.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: An American tank crew get lost in the desert during the retreat from El Alamein and face a desperate race against time to reach a source of water in an abandoned fortress - only to discover the Nazis are heading for the same location. Second World War melodrama which is all the more effective thanks to the straightforward nature of the plot and action. Humphrey Bogart, J Carrol Naish, Dan Duryea and Rex Ingram are among the excellent cast.

programme.title: The Gunfighter
programme.desc: Gunslinger Jimmy Ringo looks forward to a life of domestic peace after being given a chance to settle down with his once estranged wife and their child. However, a young upstart with dreams of slaying a legend challenges Ringo to a gunfight but dies, setting his three vengeful brothers on the older man's trail. Western, starring Gregory Peck, Millard Mitchell, Karl Malden and Helen Westcott.

programme.title: Adventures in Babysitting
programme.desc: A teenager agrees to look after her neighbour's children when her date stands her up. Settling down for a night of TV, she receives a phone call from a friend asking to be rescued from a bus station. Unable to leave the children alone, she decides to take them with her, unaware of the wild journey ahead. Comedy adventure, starring Elisabeth Shue and Maia Brewton.

programme.title: Red
programme.desc: A retired CIA agent survives an assassination attempt and realises something in his past has made him a target. He sets out to reunite the members of his old hit squad to find out who is trying to kill them and why, but in the process, uncovers dangerous secrets. Action thriller, with Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich and Helen Mirren.

programme.title: Odd Thomas
programme.desc: A cook has the ability to see ghosts, and is startled to find a stranger in his town has attracted an unusually large number of spirits. He takes this as a sign that this man is going to cause a terrible disaster, so tries to find out what is going to happen and if it can be stopped. Supernatural thriller based on Dean Koontz's novel, starring Anton Yelchin and Willem Dafoe.

programme.title: Your Highness
programme.desc: Dashing Prince Fabious is the greatest hero in the kingdom, while his younger brother Thadeous is a lazy, self-centred fool. When the princess whom Fabious is due to marry is kidnapped by an evil wizard, the two brothers must go on a dangerous quest to rescue her, with a little help from a vengeful warrior woman. Fantasy comedy, with Danny McBride, James Franco and Natalie Portman.(n)

programme.title: Lifeboat
programme.desc: The survivors of a torpedoed passenger ship are set adrift in a lifeboat. As they pull out other survivors from the sea, they realise one of them is the U-boat commander responsible for the disaster. Alfred Hitchcock's Second World War drama, starring Tallulah Bankhead, Walter Slezak, William Bendix, Hume Cronyn and Henry Hull.(n)

programme.title: Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events
programme.desc: Three orphans are entrusted into the care of their sinister uncle, a master of disguise who intends to kill them for the family fortune. Quickly realising he is up to no good, the children flee, moving from one prospective guardian to the next - but their wily relative is never far behind. Comedy adventure based on the children's books, starring Jim Carrey, Meryl Streep, Jude Law, Liam Aitken and Emily Browning, with Kara and Shelby Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Percy Jackson & the Lightning Thief
programme.desc: A teenager is shocked to discover he is the son of Greek god Poseidon and has been accused of stealing Zeus's lightning bolt. The youngster is given 14 days to find the culprit and return the missing item before the furious deity instigates an apocalyptic war. Fantasy adventure, starring Logan Lerman, Pierce Brosnan, Brandon T Jackson, Alexandra Daddario, Jake Abel, Sean Bean and Steve Coogan.(n)

programme.title: Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters
programme.desc: The modern-day teenage son of the Greek god Poseidon must lead his friends on a perilous journey into the Bermuda triangle. They need to recover the legendary Golden Fleece to save the world, but getting to it means braving all manner of terrifying monsters. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Logan Lerman and Alexandra Daddario.(n)

programme.title: Airplane
programme.desc: The passengers on board an ill-fated airliner become increasingly jittery when the flight crew flounder during a food-poisoning crisis. As ground control personnel struggle heroically to ensure the plane lands safely, a traumatised war veteran must face his fear to take the controls. Spoof disaster movie, starring Robert Hays, Leslie Nielsen, Robert Stack and Lloyd Bridges.(n)

programme.title: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A disorganised woman is asked to be maid of honour at her best friend's wedding. Taking charge of the prenuptial bridal celebrations, she resolves to give her pal and accompanying bridesmaids the time of their lives, but as her efforts slide into chaos she finds the wife of the groom's boss is keen to usurp her position. Comedy, with Kristen Wiig, Rose Byrne and Melissa McCarthy.(n)

programme.title: Magic Mike
programme.desc: A male stripper who is the star attraction in a nightclub teaches a talented young dancer the tricks of the trade, while also introducing him to his hedonistic world. The veteran performer falls for his protege's sister, but finds his wild lifestyle comes between them. Steven Soderbergh's comedy drama, with Channing Tatum, Matthew McConaughey, Olivia Munn and Alex Pettyfer.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The family find a runaway boy hiding in the barn, and learns he has walked all the way from North Carolina. Guest starring Todd Bridges.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason meets a woman who is living like a hermit when he goes looking for work, and through their shared love of music, coaxes her to come out of hiding.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Isaiah Edwards is mistakenly identified as part of an outlaw gang when the infamous Younger brothers are released from prison and set about rebuilding their reputation.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura wins a writing competition and travels to Minneapolis to meet a publisher who encourages her to pen her first book. However, the editor has other ideas for her work.

programme.title: Friendly Fire
programme.desc: A distraught woman struggles to overcome a wall of silence to find out the truth about her soldier son's death during the Vietnam War. As revelations about his accidental shooting emerge, the mourning mother launches a crusade against America's involvement in the conflict. Drama based on a true story, starring Carol Burnett, Ned Beatty, Sam Waterson and Dennis Erdman.

programme.title: Jacqueline Bouvier Kennedy
programme.desc: The first of a two-part mini-series exploring the life of the First Lady, from her years as a photojournalist to her husband's election as President. Starring Jaclyn Smith and James Franciscus.

programme.title: Undercover Christmas
programme.desc: An FBI agent reluctantly agrees to keep a close eye on a waitress who put herself in the firing line when she spoke up about her boyfriend's criminal activities. However, the witness protection job takes a turn for the unexpected when the lawman has to return to his hometown for Christmas - dragging the damsel in distress with him. Romantic comedy, starring Jami Gertz, Shawn Christian and Tyne Daly.

programme.title: Quest for Justice
programme.desc: A 1950s newspaper publisher battles for black integration in her hometown, which is divided by racism. Drama, starring Jane Seymour, DW Moffett, Richard Kiley, Lou Walker and Michelle Joyner.

programme.title: Murder So Sweet
programme.desc: A woman becomes convinced her smooth-talking ex-husband is responsible for the death of his latest wife, and persuades a detective to help prove her hunch. Mystery thriller, starring Harry Hamlin, Helen Shaver, KT Oslin and Terence Knox.

programme.title: Mistaken Identity
programme.desc: A mix-up in a maternity ward results in two new mothers unwittingly taking home the wrong babies - leaving them to face a terrible dilemma once the truth comes to light. Drama based on a true story, starring Melissa Gilbert, Rosanna Arquette, David Andrews and James McCaffrey.

programme.title: Between Love and Hate
programme.desc: A shy college boy goes to work as a swimming instructor at an exclusive country club during the summer holidays - only to become besotted with the wealthy mother of one of his pupils. Drama, starring Susan Lucci and Patrick Von Horn.

programme.title: Those She Left Behind
programme.desc: Affluent expectant parents Scott and Sue Grimes look forward to starting the next stage of their lives with the arrival of their first child. However, when Sue unexpectedly dies in childbirth, Scott is forced to navigate the difficulties of raising his new daughter alone, and must summon the fortitude to tackle life as a single parent. Drama, starring Gary Cole and Mary Page Keller.

programme.title: No One Could Protect Her
programme.desc: A woman is raped in her own home, but the police seem powerless to apprehend the attacker. As reports of further sexual assaults in her neighbourhood mount up, all seemingly the work of the same man, she resolves to turn detective and bring him to justice herself. Thriller based on a true story, starring Joanna Kerns, Anthony John Denison and Peter MacNeill.

programme.title: Abroad
programme.desc: An inexperienced Canadian reporter takes a job working for a London newspaper, but soon finds herself out of her depth in an unfamiliar world. Drama, starring Liane Balaban, Adam Rayner, Sally Phillips and Andrew Buchan.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Two Native Americans arrive in town and claim the mountain as their ancestral land, with the Waltons barn standing on an ancient burial ground.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The family help fix up the Baldwin sisters' seaside cottage, where they meet an English girl with a troubled past.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part one of two. Charles returns to Walnut Grove with son Albert in an attempt to steer him away from the influence of bad company.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part two of two. The truth about Albert's anger and contempt toward the world is revealed as Charles brings him back to Walnut Grove to help cure his morphine addiction.(n)

programme.title: I'll Be Home for Christmas
programme.desc: A couple in a small New England town during the Second World War await the return of their two sons and daughter for Christmas. Drama, starring Hal Holbrook, Eva Marie Saint, Jason Oliver, Courteney Cox, Peter Gallagher and Nancy Travis.(n)

programme.title: Jacqueline Bouvier Kennedy
programme.desc: The second in a two-part mini-series exploring the life of the First Lady, from her years as a photojournalist to her husband's election as President. Starring Jaclyn Smith and James Franciscus.(n)

programme.title: Mayflower Madam
programme.desc: Fact-based drama based on the life of former debutante Sydney Biddle Barrows, a descendent of the Mayflower pilgrims, who became notorious as the proprietor of a high-class New York escort agency. Candice Bergen, Chris Sarandon and Chita Rivera star.(n)

programme.title: Breach of Trust
programme.desc: A woman is devastated to learn a plane on which her husband was travelling has crashed, leaving him in a coma. However, the disaster leads to the revelation that he has been conducting a secret relationship with another woman, who did not survive the crash. What's more, they had a daughter. Drama, starring Roma Downey, William Russ and Jamie Rose.(n)

programme.title: To Live For
programme.desc: A terminally ill woman's last months are made happier by her relationship with a stranger she hopes will take care of her children. Romantic drama, starring Nancy Travis, Scott Bairstow, Jamie Renee Smith, Karen James and Viveka Davis.(n)

programme.title: Mistaken Identity
programme.desc: A mix-up in a maternity ward results in two new mothers unwittingly taking home the wrong babies - leaving them to face a terrible dilemma once the truth comes to light. Drama based on a true story, starring Melissa Gilbert, Rosanna Arquette, David Andrews and James McCaffrey.(n)

programme.title: One Against the Wind
programme.desc: Biopic of Second World War heroine Mary Lindell, who helped freedom fighters and members of the Allied forces escape the clutches of the Nazis in occupied France. Starring Judy Davis, Sam Neill, Denholm Elliot and Kate Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: A Touch of Hope
programme.desc: A man discovers he has the abilities of a faith healer. Initially reluctant, he agrees to use his gift to help doctors, but only in emergency cases. However, many in the medical community are suspicious of his claims, a conflict that comes to a head when he is asked to bring a doubting doctor's daughter out of a coma. Fact-based drama, starring Anthony Michael Hall, CCH Pounder, Abraham Benrubi and Fay Masterson.(n)

programme.title: The Promise
programme.desc: A battered wife with three children is persuaded by her sister to leave her abusive husband, but he continues to subject her to a barrage of harassment and threats - until the situation culminates in a fatal confrontation that changes the lives of all involved. Drama, starring Isabella Hofmann, Seth Adkins, Tracy Nelson and Matt Cooke.(n)

programme.title: Ambush in Waco
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the life of American religious leader David Koresh, whose belief in his own divinity eventually led to a violent and tragic confrontation with the authorities. Starring Timothy Daly and Dan Lauria.(n)

programme.title: Victim of Beauty
programme.desc: A would-be model finds her world transformed when she is spotted by an agent and thrust into the hectic life of a catwalk superstar. But her career takes a sinister turn when all the men she dates end up being murdered, and a clue from the past places her in great danger. Thriller, starring Jennifer Rubin, Peter Outerbridge, Stephen Shellen and Sally Kellerman.

programme.title: To Save the Children
programme.desc: Members of a close-knit community are stunned when the pressures of life prove too much for a former police officer, prompting him to snap in violent fashion, building a bomb and holding pupils at a local school hostage. Drama, starring Richard Thomas, Robert Urich and Wendy Crewson.

programme.title: Wife, Mother, Murderer
programme.desc: A woman desperate to escape her small town roots murders her husband, attempts to poison her child and assumes multiple fake identities, even going so far as to fake the death of one of her aliases and take on the guise of her own identical twin sister. Fact-based drama, starring Judith Light and David Ogden Stiers.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The children agree to buy their grandmother a new pair of glasses instead of spending their money at the carnival - and get a fitting reward for their big-hearted gesture.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Rumblings of discontent over the sale of a new-born calf prompt the family to join forces in a determined effort to get it back. Drama, starring Richard Thomas.

programme.title: For the Future: The Irvine Fertility Scandal
programme.desc: A childless couple undergo fertility treatment at a supposedly respectable clinic, and they are finally blessed with a baby boy. However, following the birth of their son, they begin to uncover the shocking truth behind the painful and expensive procedure. Fact-based drama, starring Marilu Henner, Randle Mell and Castulo Guerra.

programme.title: Great Escape 2: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Part one of two. A daring army major returns to Germany to capture the Gestapo officer who ordered the massacre of 50 of his men. Second World War drama, starring Christopher Reeve.

programme.title: Great Escape 2: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Part two of two. A daring army major returns to Germany to capture the Gestapo officer who ordered the massacre of 50 of his men. Second World War drama, starring Christopher Reeve.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The family celebrate having paid all their debts, but discover a friend is in desperate need of financial help. The girls try to find a suitable wife for Rev Buchanan.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: He Was Only Twelve - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of three. Charles undergoes a deep religious experience as his son's life hangs in the balance after being shot.

programme.title: Runaway Father
programme.desc: A woman who has been living in poverty for 20 years following her husband's death learns that he is still alive, having faked his demise so he could abandon his family. She resolves to track him down and force him to accept his responsibilities. Fact-based drama, starring Donna Mills and Jack Scalia.

programme.title: Complex of Fear
programme.desc: A rookie cop is assigned the tough case of tracking down a killer wreaking havoc among the residents of a housing development - and all the clues point to one of his friends. Thriller, starring Joe Don Baker, Hart Bochner and Chelsea Field.

programme.title: The Three Burials of Melquiades Estrada
programme.desc: A ranch foreman abducts the border patrol officer responsible for killing an illegal immigrant worker and forces him to atone for his crime by helping take the body back to Mexico for burial. Modern-day Western, directed by and starring Tommy Lee Jones. With Barry Pepper, Julio Cedillo and Dwight Yoakam.

programme.title: Cavedweller
programme.desc: A traumatic event forces a woman to head back to her home town and confront figures from her past - including the two daughters and abusive ex-husband she abandoned years earlier. However, her return is met with hostility by those she left behind. Drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick, Kevin Bacon, Aidan Quinn and Sherilyn Fenn.

programme.title: Mayflower Madam
programme.desc: Fact-based drama based on the life of former debutante Sydney Biddle Barrows, a descendent of the Mayflower pilgrims, who became notorious as the proprietor of a high-class New York escort agency. Candice Bergen, Chris Sarandon and Chita Rivera star.(n)

programme.title: Taming Andrew
programme.desc: A mother is distraught when her son is abducted and spends the next five years searching for him, only to suffer more pain when they are finally reunited and she discovers the emotional trauma he has endured. Fact-based drama, starring Park Overall, Jason Beghe and Seth Adkins.(n)

programme.title: Before He Wakes
programme.desc: Fact-based thriller about a greedy woman who marries and murders two wealthy husbands in succession, to acquire their fortunes, and almost succeeds in getting away scot-free. Starring Jaclyn Smith, Diana Scarwid, Hope Lange and Timothy Carhart.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: After finding himself unable to shoot a turkey while on a hunting trip, John-Boy displays his courage by saving his father's life.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Budding author John-Boy secretly borrows a typewriter to further his career, but sister Mary Ellen causes him no end of trouble by selling it to the local junk collector. Starring Richard Thomas and Judy Norton.(n)

programme.title: Jennifer: A Woman's Story
programme.desc: A shipbuilding magnate dies, and the company's board of directors divides into various factions, each determined to seize full control of the operation. The widow of the dead tycoon is determined to keep the business in the family, and battles against various schemes to take it from her. Drama, starring Elizabeth Montgomery and Bradford Dillman.(n)

programme.title: Great Escape 2: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Part two of two. A daring army major returns to Germany to capture the Gestapo officer who ordered the massacre of 50 of his men. Second World War drama, starring Christopher Reeve.(n)

programme.title: A Child's Wish
programme.desc: A distressed man takes time off work to help look after his cancer-stricken daughter, only to be fired by his uncaring boss, prompting the start of a long legal battle which even attracts the President's attention. Fact-based drama, starring John Ritter, Tess Harper, Anna Chlumsky and Bill Clinton as himself.(n)

programme.title: Thicker Than Blood
programme.desc: A man's agonising courtroom battle to gain custody of his son is dealt a crippling blow by the discovery that he isn't the youngster's real father after all. Drama, starring Peter Strauss and Rachel Ticotin.(n)

programme.title: One Against the Wind
programme.desc: Biopic of Second World War heroine Mary Lindell, who helped freedom fighters and members of the Allied forces escape the clutches of the Nazis in occupied France. Starring Judy Davis, Sam Neill, Denholm Elliot and Kate Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Mama's Gonna Buy You a Mockingbird
programme.desc: A boy struggles to cope with the death of his father as the Christmas season approaches. Drama, starring Sam Aaron and Rosa Anderson-Barker.(n)

programme.title: Against Her Will: The Carrie Buck Story
programme.desc: A woman with learning disabilities is declared unfit to raise her newborn daughter, but goes to court to fight for custody of the child. Drama, starring Marlee Matlin, Melissa Gilbert and Pat Hingle.(n)

programme.title: Deacons for Defence
programme.desc: A black man is pushed too far by the racist abuse and unprovoked violent assaults meted out by white bigots in the 1960s, and organises a defence group to fight back. Fact-based drama, starring Forest Whitaker, Adam Weiner, Jonathan Silverman and Serene Lee.(n)

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.sub-title: Little Bill Primm's Big Green Horseshoe
programme.desc: Little Bill Primm's Big Green Horseshoe. An intruder breaks into the Donovan household; Mickey plots a casino heist; Bridget celebrates her 18th birthday and struggles to maintain her independence; Ray visits Belikov in prison to strike a deal; Bunchy and Teresa navigate their marital woes under lockdown(n)

programme.title: Penn & Teller: Bull!
programme.desc: Death, Inc. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: The Descent 2
programme.desc: After the nightmarish potholing trip that killed her companions, survivor Sarah is forced to revisit the caves inhabited by terrifying cannibalistic creatures(n)

programme.title: Clerks II
programme.desc: You can take the clerks out of the Quick Stop, but you just can't take the Quick Stop out of the clerks as Dante (Brian O'Halloran) and Randall (Jeff Anderson) prove in this long-awaited sequel to Kevin Smith's breakthrough comedy. Years after we last saw them, Dante is still toiling behind the counter at a New Jersey convenience store and Randall is still annoying customers at the video shop next door -- or at least they are until a fire burns down the strip mall, forcing Dante and Randall to look for work. Times are tough, and the guys find themselves embracing the ultimate indignity as they take jobs at Mooby's, a fast-food outlet where the burgers are advertised as "udderly delicious." While Randall's snarky attitude toward the public remains unchanged, Dante is trying to make the best of the situation as he plans to marry his fiancée, Emma (Jennifer Schwalbach Smith), and move to Florida. However, Dante's plans are complicated when he falls for Becky (Rosario Dawson), a funny and tart-tongued woman who happens to be his boss at Mooby's. Lurking about in the background, as always, are Jay (Jason Mewes) and Silent Bob (Kevin Smith), who for good or ill have changed even less with the passage of time than Dante and Randall. Clerks II also features Wanda Sykes, Ethan Suplee, and Trevor Fehrman, with cameo appearances from Kevin Smith regulars Ben Affleck and Jason Lee(n)

programme.title: The Young Black Stallion
programme.desc: Striking cinematography distinguishes this family-friendly adventure, filmed in the IMAX format. A prequel to 1979's "The Black Stallion," the drama spotlights the friendship between a lovable colt and a plucky young girl (Biana Tamimi) who's lost in the desert during World War II. Simon Wincer ("Free Willy") directed. Richard Romanus, Patrick Elyas(n)

programme.title: Dragonheart
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure about a knight who is determined to rid the land of a tyrant king. Because it was dragon magic that brought the monarch to the throne, the knight is resolved to kill every dragon in the country. Finally, only one dragon remains - but instead of slaying him, the knight and the dragon join forces in an effort to restore a code of truth and honour to the land(n)

programme.title: Up in the Air
programme.desc: With a job that has him traveling around the country firing people, Ryan Bingham leads an empty life out of a suitcase, until his company does the unexpected: ground him(n)

programme.title: Notting Hill
programme.desc: A self-effacing bookshop owner bumps into a major American movie star and falls instantly in love. Romance(n)

programme.title: Big Eyes
programme.desc: The true story of painter Margaret Keane's life in obscurity while her husband gleaned the notoriety for being the face of her work is brought to the screen by Tim Burton and his Ed Wood screenwriters, Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski. The story opens in the late 1950s, when Margaret Keane (Amy Adams) packs up the car with her daughter and their personal belongings, and leaves her husband to start a new life in San Francisco. There, Margaret quickly reconnects with her old friend DeeAnn (Krysten Ritter), and falls head over heels for Walter (Christoph Waltz), an artist and part-time real-estate broker who soon shows great interest in her unique paintings of small children with strikingly expressive, saucer-like eyes. Before long, the two are married, and Walter is claiming credit for Margaret's increasingly popular paintings. With the money rolling in, Margaret initially agrees to go along with the ruse, but the closer she gets to her new husband the more she begins to realize that he's little more than a smooth-talking scam artist. Later, riddled with guild over the fact that she's been deceiving her own daughter as her paintings become a pop-culture phenomenon, Margaret leaves the increasingly abusive Walter, and moves to Hawaii. Only then does Margaret gain the confidence to reclaim the works that have been credited to her husband, even when doing so entails going before the judge and proving that she and she alone created the enchanting children with the big eyes. Danny Huston, Terence Stamp, and Jason Schwartzman co-star(n)

programme.title: Punch-Drunk Love
programme.desc: Paul Thomas Anderson follows 1999's MAGNOLIA with the intensely compelling character study PUNCH-DRUNK LOVE. Barry Egan is a quiet, shy, socially awkward man with an office in an out-of-the-way warehouse. He is dedicated to his job as a wholesale toilet plunger salesman, he keeps a nice apartment, and he is obsessed with special offers on grocery store products..(n)

programme.title: The Usual Suspects
programme.desc: Near the end of The Usual Suspects, Kevin Spacey, in his Oscar-winning performance as crippled con man Roger "Verbal" Kint, says, "The greatest trick the Devil ever pulled was convincing the world he didn't exist." This may be the key line in this story; the farther along the movie goes, the more one realizes that not everything is quite what it seems, and what began as a conventional whodunit turns into something quite different. A massive explosion rips through a ship in a San Pedro, CA, harbor, leaving 27 men dead, the lone survivor horribly burned, and 91 million dollars' worth of cocaine, believed to be on board, mysteriously missing. Police detective Dave Kujan (Chazz Palminteri) soon brings in the only witness and key suspect, "Verbal" Kint. Kint's nickname stems from his inability to keep his mouth shut, and he recounts the events that led to the disaster. Five days earlier, a truckload of gun parts was hijacked in Queens, NY, and five men were brought in as suspects: Kint, hot-headed hipster thief McManus (Stephen Baldwin), ill-tempered thug Hockney (Kevin Pollak), flashy wise guy Fenster (Benicio Del Toro), and Keaton (Gabriel Byrne), a cop gone bad now trying to go straight in the restaurant business. While in stir, someone suggests that they should pull a job together, and Kint hatches a plan for a simple and lucrative jewel heist. Despite Keaton's misgivings, the five men pull off the robbery without a hitch and fly to Los Angeles to fence the loot. Their customer asks if they'd be interested in pulling a quick job while out West; the men agree, but the robbery goes horribly wrong and they soon find themselves visited by Kobayashi (Pete Postlethwaite), who represents a criminal mastermind named Keyser Soze. Soze's violent reputation is so infamous that he's said to have responded to a threat to murder his family by killing them himself, just to prove that he feared no one. When Kobayashi passes along a heist proposed by Soze that sounds like suicide, the men feel that they have little choice but to agree(n)

programme.title: Woman in Gold
programme.desc: A Jewish woman attempts to reclaim her family's property, which was stolen six decades earlier during WWII. With the help of an ambitious young lawyer, she starts legal proceedings in various countries around the world(n)

Along the way, the unlikely pair discover life has more to teach them both(n)

programme.title: The Alamo
programme.desc: With Dennis Quaid and Billy Bob Thornton in the cast, this historical drama features magnificent war scenes as it reconstructs the revolution over the independence of Texas, in 1836 –before, during and after the construction of the Alamo (a fort built by Spanish missionaries to catechize the natives). Texans and Tejanos (born in Mexico), led by William Travis, Davy Crockett (Thornton) and Jim Bowie, are besieged by an army commanded by Mexican dictator Antonio Lopez de Santa Ana. Later, however, the outcome of the battle of San Jacinto, under General Sam Houston (Dennis Quaid), is the defeat of the Santa Ana men, which finally leads to the independence of the state(n)

programme.title: The Royal Tenenbaums
programme.desc: Director Wes Anderson and his longtime friend and writing partner Owen Wilson follow up Bottle Rocket (1996) and Rushmore (1998) with this similarly offbeat comedy about a dysfunctional family reunion. Royal Tenenbaum (Gene Hackman) was a successful attorney who had three children with his wife Etheline (Anjelica Huston), an archaeologist. Each of the Tenenbaum kids was a precocious genius: Chas (Ben Stiller) made a killing as a child investor. Richie (Luke Wilson) was a junior tennis champ and three-time U.S. Nationals winner. The adopted Margot (Gwyneth Paltrow) was a playwright who won a 50,000-dollar Braverman Grant in the ninth grade. When Royal abruptly left his family, however, it was the beginning of two decades of betrayal and failure that would scar the Tenenbaums for life. Their past resentments are bitterly held against Royal when he suddenly reappears, claiming to have six weeks to live and a desire to reconnect with his family. Typically, Royal's story is a sham, but his presence and sincere desire for absolution soon have a profound effect on the Tenenbaums, who are each dealing with thwarted desires and relationships. Among them are Richie's lifelong love for Margot, who's unhappily married to Raleigh St.Clair (Bill Murray) and Etheline's eccentric engagement to Henry Sherman (Danny Glover), who wishes to marry her. The Royal Tenenbaums also co-stars Owen Wilson and features narration provided by Alec Baldwin(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible 2

But when the beautiful woman becomes infected, there is a race against time to save her - and the entire human race(n)

programme.title: Exorcismus
programme.desc: A fiercely independent 15-year-old girl falls under supernatural attack in this harrowing horror film from Spain. When Emma Hawkins begins to suffer from involuntary fits, her parents begin to fear that she has a serious medical problem. Though their concerns are initially eased following a series of rigorous physical and psychological tests, it soon becomes obvious that something horrible is stirring deep inside of Emma's soul. No doctor can help Emma now, and in order to purge the blackness within, her parents must turn to a healer with the power of God on their side

programme.title: The Abandoned
programme.desc: An adopted girl returns to her homeland of Russia to explore the dilapidated mountain farm she has recently inherited, only to discover that it harbors a deadly secret in the feature debut from Aftermath director Nacho Cerdà. Shortly after the mysterious death of her birth mother, young Marie was adopted and brought to live in the United States. When Marie receives word that she has inherited an isolated farm in her native Russia, she soon sets out to explore the vast estate and peel away the thick gauze obscuring her secret-shrouded past. Confounded by the local's refusal to show her to the "damned" locale and determined not to give up after coming this far, Marie convinces a man to take her there only to discover that he has inexplicably vanished shortly after arrival. As Marie sets out to explore the ominous and expansive property alone, a surprise encounter with a man named Boris, who claims to have been lured to the house under similar circumstances, sets into motion a chilling series of events in which the ghosts of the past -- as well as deceased doppelgangers of both Marie and Boris -- prevent the frightened pair from leaving. In the terrifying hours that follow, both of these tormented lost souls will find that sometimes the past is best left forgotten

programme.title: The Day
programme.desc: A small band of friends make an uneasy alliance with a mysterious lone wolf in this blend of horror and adventure. An unnamed catastrophe has turned the Earth into a wasteland, and as packs of feral cannibals wander the countryside, a dwindling number of survivors struggle to stay alive. Rick (Dominic Monaghan), Adam (Shawn Ashmore), Henson (Cory Hardrict), and Shannon (Shannyn Sossamon) have been journeying together for months and are the last living members of a much larger group. Mary (Ashley Bell) is a solitary woman who crossed paths with the survivors and is now traveling with them. She isn't interested in discussing her past or becoming friends, but the others learn she's a powerful ally in a fight. The travelers take shelter in a house, but are soon surrounded by cannibals; they quickly realize just how strong a warrior Mary can be, while also discovering the terrible truth that led her to wander alone. The Day was directed by Douglas Aarniokoski, who has accumulated extensive credits as an assistant director and helming second-unit material on major films(n)

programme.title: See No Evil
programme.desc: World Wrestling Entertainment superstar Kane gives a killer performance as a deranged, hulking psychopath who terrorizes eight teens working to rehab a decrepit hotel. It's no-holds-barred mayhem as the murderer employs a variety of different weapons and instruments to dispatch his victims. Directed by Gregory Dark. programme.title: The Way of the Gun
programme.desc: In this suspense thriller, two small-time crooks make a bid for the big time with disastrous results. Robin (Juliette Lewis) is carrying a child as a surrogate mother for a wealthy couple, Hale and Francesca Chidduck (Scott Wilson and Kristin Lehman) when she's kidnapped by Parker (Ryan Phillippe) and Longbaugh (Benicio Del Toro), who believe that the adoptive parents will pay a large ransom to ensure the safety of both mother and baby. The kidnappers soon discover that they're out of their league when they're confronted by Mafia-connected lawyer Joe Sarno (James Caan) and a pair of hired killers, Jeffers (Taye Diggs) and Obecks (Nicky Katt); at the same time, Parker finds himself increasingly attached to Robin. The Way of the Gun marked the directorial debut of screenwriter Christopher McQuarrie, whose script credits include The Usual Suspects and Public Access

programme.title: Delta Farce
programme.desc: When a hard-luck blue-collar worker and his two best friends are mistaken for Army Reservists by a tough-talking Army sergeant, the plane set to fly them to the front lines of Iraq mistakenly drops them in the middle of Mexico to disastrous results in a freewheeling military comedy starring Larry the Cable Guy, Bill Engvall, and D.J. Qualls. Larry (the Cable Guy) has lost his job and his woman in the short span of 24 hours. Convinced that some suds and target shooting are just the right remedies for a broken, jobless heart, Larry sets out with his next-door neighbor Bill (Engvall) and their trigger-happy pal Everett (Qualls) in order to blast off some rounds and down some brews. Their relaxing weekend soon takes an unexpected turn, however, when hard-case Army sergeant Kilgrove (Keith David) mistakes the trio as slacking Army reservists and loads them in a plane bound for Fallujah. Subsequently air-dropped over Mexico due to pilot error, the clueless, wannabe war heroes become convinced that they're actually in the Middle East and set out to save a rural village from what they assume to be an insurgent uprising. Though the thankful locals champion the noble but dimwitted trio for their heroism, the celebration is short-lived as ruthless warlord Carlos Santana (Danny Trejo) pays a personal visit to the town with a plan to confront the fearless warriors who dared to challenge his iron-fist rule

Directors Roger Corman and Sidney Lumet have cameos. Tina Sinatra, whose father Frank starred in the original, co-produced

programme.title: Big Eyes
programme.desc: The true story of painter Margaret Keane's life in obscurity while her husband gleaned the notoriety for being the face of her work is brought to the screen by Tim Burton and his Ed Wood screenwriters, Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski. The story opens in the late 1950s, when Margaret Keane (Amy Adams) packs up the car with her daughter and their personal belongings, and leaves her husband to start a new life in San Francisco. There, Margaret quickly reconnects with her old friend DeeAnn (Krysten Ritter), and falls head over heels for Walter (Christoph Waltz), an artist and part-time real-estate broker who soon shows great interest in her unique paintings of small children with strikingly expressive, saucer-like eyes. Before long, the two are married, and Walter is claiming credit for Margaret's increasingly popular paintings. With the money rolling in, Margaret initially agrees to go along with the ruse, but the closer she gets to her new husband the more she begins to realize that he's little more than a smooth-talking scam artist. Later, riddled with guild over the fact that she's been deceiving her own daughter as her paintings become a pop-culture phenomenon, Margaret leaves the increasingly abusive Walter, and moves to Hawaii. Only then does Margaret gain the confidence to reclaim the works that have been credited to her husband, even when doing so entails going before the judge and proving that she and she alone created the enchanting children with the big eyes. Danny Huston, Terence Stamp, and Jason Schwartzman co-star(n)

programme.title: Big Eyes
programme.desc: The true story of painter Margaret Keane's life in obscurity while her husband gleaned the notoriety for being the face of her work is brought to the screen by Tim Burton and his Ed Wood screenwriters, Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski. The story opens in the late 1950s, when Margaret Keane (Amy Adams) packs up the car with her daughter and their personal belongings, and leaves her husband to start a new life in San Francisco. There, Margaret quickly reconnects with her old friend DeeAnn (Krysten Ritter), and falls head over heels for Walter (Christoph Waltz), an artist and part-time real-estate broker who soon shows great interest in her unique paintings of small children with strikingly expressive, saucer-like eyes. Before long, the two are married, and Walter is claiming credit for Margaret's increasingly popular paintings. With the money rolling in, Margaret initially agrees to go along with the ruse, but the closer she gets to her new husband the more she begins to realize that he's little more than a smooth-talking scam artist. Later, riddled with guild over the fact that she's been deceiving her own daughter as her paintings become a pop-culture phenomenon, Margaret leaves the increasingly abusive Walter, and moves to Hawaii. Only then does Margaret gain the confidence to reclaim the works that have been credited to her husband, even when doing so entails going before the judge and proving that she and she alone created the enchanting children with the big eyes. Danny Huston, Terence Stamp, and Jason Schwartzman co-star(n)

programme.title: Seventh Moon
programme.desc: A romantic trip to China turns into a lunar nightmare for a pair of happy newlyweds when their taxi driver ditches them in a remote village, and the locals offer them up as sacrifices for the menacing moon creatures that return to Earth annually to replenish their ranks. According to Chinese legend, the dead return to Earth on the seventh month of the lunar year, when the moon glows full in the night sky. America-born Yul (Tim Chiou) and his new wife Melissa (Amy Smart) had just arrived in China to meet Yul's family when their idyllic getaway takes a sudden turn for the worse. When night falls and their tour guide leaves them stranded in a darkened, boarded-up village, Yul and Amy quickly realize that this wasn't a planned stop. Once a year, the lunar creatures return to Earth in search of a sacrifice. Yul and Amy have just been offered up, and now in order to avoid being assimilated into the collective that pursues them through the darkened forest, they will have to survive until the morning light casts the frightful beasts back to the moon for another year(n)

programme.title: According to Spencer
programme.desc: A young man moves to Los Angeles to make something of himself -- but finds that such a task might take a little more work than he thought -- in this romantic comedy. According to Spencer stars Jesse Bradford as the titular Spencer, an ad agency mail room clerk just-arrived in L.A. and eager to make his presence felt. Renting a room in a run-down mansion, Spencer crosses paths with shady eccentrics Ezra (David Krumholtz) and Feldy (Adam Goldberg), aspiring porn filmmakers who convince him to make inroads as a commercial director -- with little success. But when Spencer serendipitously meets his childhood sweetheart Melora (Mia Kirshner), who's currently stuck in a go-nowhere relationship with the smarmy Craig (Brad Rowe), things begin to look up

programme.title: Igby Goes Down

After being kicked out of several boarding schools and escaping from a military academy, Igby Slocumb hides out in the apartment of his sleazy godfather's mistress. He starts dating an art student, but as he gets drawn further into the mind games and hypocrisy of the adult world, his already jaded outlook grows even darker

programme.title: Home Alone

programme.title: Camp Nowhere
programme.desc: This light-hearted comedy depicts a typical summer camp, but with a special twist: this camp was designed by the campers themselves! "Mud" Himmel is a nerd. Once again he is faced with attending computer camp. His buddy Zack will be marching into go to military camp while Trish is acting happy about theater camp. That Gaby is going again to fat camp weighs heavily upon her mind. None of them are thrilled with their camp prospects and it is rebellious Mud who suggest that they create their own, secret camp. Enter Dennis Van Welker, their crazy high school drama instructor. He offers to join the conspiracy and act as their camp counselor. Just as it looks as if the four misfits are going to have a really great summer together, two dozen of their peers find out about the camp and decide to come along. For a time it's one big chaotic party. But as the kids act out their camp fantasies, they are gaining valuable insight into their lives

Drawing partly on his own real-life experiences of stripping when he was a teen, Tatum plays the movie's eponymous central character. Mike is in his 30s and has for some time earned his living by disrobing for the cash-paying audiences who frequent the Xquisite All-Male Revue. However, he's given reason to reassess the way his life is going when a new young recruit, Adam, joins the team. The enthusiasm with which Adam embraces his new lifestyle only serves to sharpen Mike's awareness of its shallowness; and then there's Adam's sister Brooke, who Mike begins to fall in love with..(n)

Professionally, Peter is near the very bottom of the world tennis ranks, and personally, he can't find love despite his best efforts to do so. In a rare turn of events, however, Peter is chosen as a wildcard to play at Wimbledon, the tennis world's most prestigious competition. While there, he meets American Lizzie Bradbury, the "bad girl of tennis", and his confidence on and off the court improves tenfold as he falls in love with her. programme.title: Charlotte's Web
programme.desc: This animated musical, based on E.B. White's children's book classic, is about a courageous spider who helps save the life of an ill-fated pig. Wilbur is a young pig (voice of Henry Gibson) who's owned by New England farmer Homer Zuckerman (voice of Robert Holt). One day he is sold to a neighbor, where he meets a sheep who warns him that his fate lies in the confines of the slaughterhouse. Wilbur is terrified of this news until he meets Charlotte, a charming spider (voice of Debbie Reynolds), who is determined to save Wilbur from this dire destiny. By weaving words into her web, she convinces the farmer that Wilbur is some sort of prodigious animal too important to kill. The music for Charlotte's Web was written by Richard M. Sherman and Robert B. Sherman, who wrote the scores for countless Disney movies, including Mary Poppins and The Jungle Book(n)

When he gets appointed to see naval psychiatrist Dr. Jerome Davenport (Denzel Washington), he begins to reveal the emotional problems behind his rage. programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: 2016 is the BBC's 'Year of the Story' and as part of the celebration, the award winning Horrible Histories returns with a one-off special about Staggering Storytellers. Who wrote the first detective novel? When were books invented? Why do we like stories so much? In its own distinctive and irreverently accurate style, the episode takes a look at some of literature's greatest works and history's wackiest writers. Along the way we see the development of storytelling technology; we learn how a party at Lord Byron's house led to the writing of the Gothic masterpiece Frankenstein, and how Charles Dickens was the Harry Styles of his day. Spanning 3,000 years of recorded history we take a look at the funny and ridiculous ways some of our finest writers cured their writing block - did you know Tennyson used to pretend to go the loo as a party trick? Plus, of course, our trusty host Rattus to guide the way.
